title: Kulu: the happy valley
creator_credit: R.L. Storey and Documentary Films of India
brief_description: Describes the once remote Kulu Valley in India, its people and their traditional customs and how the district is a hiker’s paradise and popular summer resort. The valley is a trading route for Mongolians with their pack animals, and fairs are major occasions. Pilgrims also make their way to this valley and its sacred temple.
